body_html:
We just ran into the same issue, also using CentOS 6 and GCC 4.x on our HPC cluster. It seems, there is still a lot of demand for official support for these aging distros / compilers.

Note: This might not be a CentOS 6 only problem, I suppose, this might as well be pinned to GCC 4.x or GCC < 6, not necessarily exclusive to CentOS 6. Not sure, though.

I don't see a .travis.yml. If you would set up Travis CI or CI framework of your choice, I suppose, the community would even pitch in and contribute the CentOS 6 testing without too much effort on your part.

body:
We just ran into the same issue, also using CentOS 6 and GCC 4.x on our HPC cluster. It seems, there is still a lot of demand for official support for these aging distros / compilers.

**Note:** This might not be a CentOS 6 only problem, I suppose, this might as well be pinned to GCC 4.x or GCC < 6, not necessarily exclusive to CentOS 6. Not sure, though.

I don't see a `.travis.yml`. If you would set up Travis CI or CI framework of your choice, I suppose, the community would even pitch in and contribute the CentOS 6 testing without too much effort on your part.
